title_sort: walt whitman to anne gilchrist, 17 march [1877]
title: Walt Whitman to Anne Gilchrist, 17 March [1877]
text: Esopus-on-HudsonNew YorkMarch 17Dearest friendAfter a couple of weeks in New York, Mr Burroughs has brought me up here, where I am to stay for a few days—Every thing goes well—I am very comfortably situated, & it is not only a great change from N YNew York—but a great relief—I mean the excitement of so much company—every thing is quiet & secluded here—all winter too, the snow white & deep in every direction—as I look from my window, river & mountains & trees & rocks—far & vast—I only write a hurried line to let you know my whereabouts—Shall (probably) be returning to Camden latter part of next week—Love to all—Walt Whitman Walt Whitman to Anne Gilchrist, 17 March [1877]
